intro: Rondeletia miraflorensis, commonly known as the Andean rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface. Rondeletia miraflorensis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests.
